job.title: Senior Data Scientist
job.body:
About the Team:

Our data science team is a dynamic and collaborative group of experts dedicated to driving data-driven decisions and innovation. We work on challenging problems, leverage cutting-edge technologies, and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to unlock insights from data and deliver business value.

The role:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Scientist to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for leading advanced analytics projects, developing predictive models, and providing actionable insights. You will work closely with different stakeholders to identify business opportunities, solve complex problems, and drive data-driven decision-making.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead end-to-end data science projects, from problem formulation to model deployment.
  • Utilize advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to analyze large datasets and extract meaningful insights.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data science solutions.
  • Develop and deploy predictive models to solve complex business problems, such as recommendation engines, churn prediction, or demand forecasting.
  • Conduct A/B tests and experiments to validate hypotheses and measure the impact of data-driven solutions.
  • Mentor and provide guidance to junior data scientists and analysts.
  • Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies in data science and machine learning.

Minimum Requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience in data science or related roles.
  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
  • Proven expertise using machine learning techniques and algorithms to improve business performance.
  • Experience with data manipulation and analysis using libraries like Pandas, NumPy, and SciPy.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Advanced Level of English.

Preferred requirements:

  • Master's or Ph.D. in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering).
  • Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).
  • Knowledge of deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
  • Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Previous experience in a leadership or mentoring role.
  • Strong data visualization skills using tools like Tableau or Power BI.
  • Contributions to open-source projects or publications in relevant conferences or journals.

Benefits

•Health Insurance coverage

• PTO policy and paid sick days.

•We grow, you grow: Stock Options Plan granted on Day 1.

• 401k Plan.

• Family leave: 12 weeks for primary caregiver and 6 weeks for secondary caregiver, fully paid.

• Compassionate Leave: 3-5 days each time the need arises.

• A generous amount of CookUnity credits to enjoy our amazing meals, added to your account, monthly.

•?• Wellness perks: access to a nutritional coach and fitness subsidies to build a healthy lifestyle.

•?• Personalized Spanish coach.

•Awesome opportunity to join a company that is looking to change how we eat and how chefs work!

If you’re interested in this role, please submit your application and if we think you might be a fit, we'll get in touch with you. Thank you for your time!

job.title: Lifecycle Marketing Manager
job.body:
About the Team:

At CookUnity, the CRM team is responsible for driving new eaters across CRM channels, retaining subscribers, and resurrecting churn users. The CRM team embodies being scrappy, creative, and extremely data-driven across our various strategies. This is a unique opportunity to join a growing CRM team that is working on building a world-class lifecycle marketing program. You will be working alongside our CRM team, comprised of the Director of CRM, a Lifecycle Marketing Associate, and a CRM coordinator. You will report directly to the Director of CRM.

The role:

As our Lifecycle Marketing Manager, you will play a pivotal role in driving customer engagement across multiple touch points, including email, SMS, in-app, and push notifications. Your primary focus will be on driving strategic initiatives to increase trial acquisition, enhance customer retention, extend customer lifetime value (LTV), and resurrect users who churned back onto our subscription.

Responsibilities:

  • Customer Engagement Strategy: Identify opportunities to engage customers throughout their journey, reduce churn, boost customer sentiment, and ultimately elevate LTV.
  • Lead Conversion Strategy: Optimize our retargeting flows and ad-hoc campaign strategy to increase our trial conversion rate and optimize for net revenue per lead.
  • Lead Capture Strategy: Partner with the CRO manager and product teams to develop a testing plan to increase lead capture rate and CRM trial acquisition contribution.
  • Segmentation & Personalization: Develop a detailed segmentation and personalization plan to help drive KPIs across acquisition, retention, and resurrection.
  • Testing Strategy and framework: Ideate, build, and optimize testing strategy for acquisition, retention, and resurrection efforts.
  • Campaign Management and Automation: Work alongside CRM Director, Lifecycle Marketing Associate, and CRM coordinator and collaborate with the data team to design and implement robust processes for campaign management and marketing automation. This includes utilizing tools, creating efficient workflows, conducting A/B testing, implementing customer profiling and segmentation, personalization strategies, managing triggered events, and defining customer journeys and activation strategies to drive retention KPIs.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate effectively with various teams across the organization, including performance marketing, brand marketing, data, portfolio, product, tech, etc., to drive the successful implementation of email marketing initiatives.
  • Reporting / Analytics: Drive improvements to reporting structure, and analytics and lead weekly CRM reviews with key cross-functional stakeholders

Minimum Requirements:

  • 5+ years of email marketing experience for D2C brands, particularly in subscription-based businesses.
  • Experience using email marketing platforms, with a preference for experience with Customer.io, Braze, or similar tools.
  • Previous experience working in email, SMS, push notifications, and in-app CRM channels.
  • The agility and proactiveness to thrive in a fast-paced environment where priorities will shift, and processes may not yet exist.
  • Exceptional project management and organizational skills, with meticulous attention to detail.
  • Proficiency in HTML and CSS for email production (a plus).
  • Action-oriented, proactive, and high-energy approach to driving change within the organization.

Preferred requirements:

  • Advanced knowledge of email marketing tools and platforms.
  • Experience with other email marketing tools in addition to customer.io.
  • Deep understanding of subscription-based business models and strategies.
  • Previous experience in a senior or lead role within email marketing or CRM.
  • Proficiency in additional coding languages or data analytics tools relevant to email marketing.
  • Experience using Tableau and MixPanel.

Benefits

•Health Insurance coverage

• PTO policy and paid sick days

•401k Plan.

• Family leave: 12 weeks for primary caregiver and 6 weeks for secondary caregiver, fully paid

•Compassionate Leave: 3-5 days each time the need arises

•A generous amount of CookUnity credits to enjoy our amazing meals, added to your account, monthly

•?•Wellness perks: access to a nutritional coach and fitness subsidies to build a healthy lifestyle

•?•Personalized Spanish coach

•Awesome opportunity to join a company that is looking to change how we eat and how chefs work!

Compensation

All final pay rates will be determined by candidates experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.

Pay Range for this position

$90,000—$108,000 USD

If you’re interested in this role, please submit your application and if we think you might be a fit, we'll get in touch with you. Thank you for your time!

job.title: Inbound Receiving Associate
job.body:
Who we are

CookUnity is the first ever chef-to-consumer platform. Connecting a diverse group of talented chefs with busy food lovers, we're elevating the at-home dining experience.

We are growing rapidly and looking for hard-working, passionate team members that will help us become more efficient, faster, and reliable to our customers.

We are always learning and growing – if this sounds like an environment where you would thrive, we'd love to hear from you

Tasks:

  • Receive shipments, check for damages and sort stock for distribution in the market/warehouse
  • Keep record of invoices sent and received
  • Fill orders by taking items from the warehouse and prepare them for delivery to chefs
  • Keep track record of chefs ingredient requirements and returns
  • Monitor shelves and fill them in when needed
  • Keep up with the movement of merchandise in the store and warehouse
  • Weekly counting of assigned inventory

Qualifications

  • Must be at least 18 years old
  • High School Diploma or GED
  • You are eligible to work in the U.S.
  • Bilingual English/Spanish, preferred
  • Must be familiar with FIFO and food safety regulations
  • You are reliable: punctual and regular attendance is required — changing the way the world eats and chef work takes heart and discipline!
  • Ability to operate a pallet jack is helpful but not required
  • Experience working in a food facility is helpful but not required
  • Able to stand or walk for 8 hour shifts and carry up to 50 pounds
  • Occasionally may be required to work in a cold refrigerated area kept at 35 degrees

Benefits:

  • Competitive hourly rates
  • Medical, Dental and Vision
  • 401K
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • Full-time, Part-time, and Overnight positions available

job.title: Talent Acquisition Specialist
job.body:
About the Team:

Our team at CookUnity is a diverse and passionate group of professionals dedicated to reshaping the culinary industry. We're united by our love for food, innovation, and the mission to make high-quality, chef-crafted meals accessible to everyone. As part of our Talent team in Buenos Aires, you'll be joining a lean, resourceful but most important, collaborative group that values autonomy, growth, and excellence. We work together to identify and bring exceptional talent to the table, ensuring CookUnity's continued success and impact.

The role:

As a Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist, you will be the driving force behind our talent acquisition efforts. You will strategically partner and coach hiring teams across the organization, with a main focus on collaborating with US-based roles.

Your expertise and passion are to lead and own the full recruiting process from end to end (sourcing, scheduling, offers, and everything in between). You’ll help us attract values-aligned talent as well as develop, implement, and execute recruiting strategies. The right person is a team player who thrives in startup culture, wears multiple hats, and is able to work with ownership and urgency in a highly ambiguous environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Execute end-to-end recruitment for various roles across our teams, targeting candidates with a growth mindset.
  • Collaborate closely with hiring managers, offering valuable insights and feedback as a strategic business partner.
  • Articulate and communicate the compelling value proposition of CookUnity to prospective candidates.
  • Ensure a seamless and positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process by maintaining consistent touchpoints and exemplary follow-through.
  • Organize and facilitate talent review debriefs and be a trusted voice in difficult conversations that result in decision-making
  • Close the loop by extending offers, leading negotiations, and facilitating the candidate's onboarding journey
  • Elevate the bar of the recruiting team by sharing knowledge and best practices.

Minimum Requirements:

  • +4 years of Talent Acquisition Experience: Proven track record in sourcing and recruiting candidates across different departments.
  • Full-Life Cycle Recruiting: Demonstrated expertise in performing full-cycle recruiting, with a preference for in-house experience.
  • US-Centric Experience: Prior experience in recruiting for companies headquartered in the US while collaboratively working with Hiring Managers based there.
  • Exceptional Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills, with advanced/bilingual English proficiency.
  • Tech-Savvy: Proficiency in working with Applicant Tracking Systems.
  • Prioritization Skills: Ability to effectively prioritize and manage competing tasks.
  • Startup Enthusiast: Make things happen attitude
  • Leadership Potential: Enthusiastic about the opportunity to grow into a leadership role as the company expands.
  • Advanced Level of English.

Preferred requirements:

  • Market Awareness: A deep understanding of industry trends and talent market dynamics, allowing for proactive adjustments to recruitment strategies.
  • Employer Branding: Experience in employer branding strategies to attract top talent and elevate the company's reputation as an employer of choice.
  • Analytical, motivated, quick learner, adept at multitasking, and resourceful.

Benefits

• Get paid in USD, Crypto, Euro, ARS. Whatever your choice! We use Deel to make things easier for you!

•Work remotely: design the life that you want.

•Enjoy 15 days of vacation each year from the start date.

•16 fully paid Argentinean holidays.

•Compassionate Leave: 3-5 days each time the need arises.

•Family leave of 12 weeks for primary caregiver and 6 weeks for secondary caregiver, fully paid.

• Wellness benefit: Gympass subscription, a well-being platform that offers the best coverage of top gyms, studios, and activities for you to choose from.

•Meal benefit.

•?•Personalized English coach

CookUnity is the first ever chef-to-consumer platform. Connecting a diverse group of talented chefs with busy food lovers, we're elevating the at-home dining experience.

We are growing rapidly and looking for hard-working, passionate team members that will help us become more efficient, faster, and reliable to our customers.

We are always learning and growing – if this sounds like an environment where you would thrive, we'd love to hear from you!

job.body:
The Culinary Manager is responsible for providing operational oversight and strong leadership to a growing team of associates and supervisors. This individual will have their hands in multiple aspects of the facility, managing the optimization and execution of Kitchen operations, and managing the dish and cleaning teams.

Success for this role is to become a partner, and ally, to our chef community making sure they have everything they need to execute an optimal menu strategy and execution.

As Culinary Manager, you will also be collaborating across multiple departments focusing on providing the best experience for our eaters.

job.title: Graphic Designer
job.body:
About the Team:

Our creative team is a dynamic and collaborative group of talented professionals dedicated to enhancing our brand's visual identity. We thrive on innovation and creativity, working together to deliver outstanding design solutions.

The role:

We are looking for a talented Graphic Designer to join our team and contribute to our company's branding and design efforts. As a Graphic Designer, you will play a crucial role in creating visually appealing and on-brand graphics for various digital and print materials. You'll work closely with our creative team to maintain and enhance our brand identity.

Responsibilities:

  • We are looking for a team player to collaborate with our Project Manager, and other talented design members to support, multi-task and explore concepts, iterate design layouts, and produce on-brand assets.
  • Create visually stunning graphics that align with our brand guidelines to support campaign and marketing collateral, social media content, promotional content, website elements, and product packaging.
  • Collaborate with the brand marketing team to ensure consistency in design across all touch points.
  • Attention to detail and strong typography skills are a must.
  • Experience with and knowledge of online media, CRM emails, social networks, digital trends, motion graphics and minor photoshop retouching would be appreciated.

  • Having a background in food branding design would be advantageous, but not essential.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Graphic Design or a related field.
  • A strong design portfolio showcasing your creativity and design skills.
  • Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator) and Figma.
  • Excellent typography skills and meticulous attention to detail.

  • High energy, enthusiasm, and a passion for design.
  • Advanced level of English

  • Some experience in UX/UI design or related coursework is advantageous but not mandatory.

job.title: VP, Growth Marketing
job.body:
About the Team:

The Growth Marketing Team leads the company's efforts to acquire new eaters across a variety of channels. This is more than the ambition of expanding audiences, increasing traffic and conversion rate whilst keeping CAC low. CookUnity has an incredible chef-driven story to tell—and a mind-blowing, must-taste product to introduce to the world. And because of this, the sky is the limit in crafting an alluring proposition and leveraging magnetic content. We have an incredible mission, as a marketing team, to not simply shake up the known Weekly Meal Plans and On-Demand Food Delivery categories, but usher in a new era of the chef-centric marketplace.

The role:

We're looking for a VP of Growth Marketing who will develop and execute strategies that generate new leads and consumers through online marketing campaigns. You will be in charge of the acquisition marketing, attribution and analytics, strategic management, campaign execution, new channel discovery and experimentation, and optimization across channels. You will also be responsible for leadership of the Growth Marketing team, day-to-day tactical and strategic operations, as well as support sales and marketing analytics to drive performance improvements across the business.

As the VP of Growth Marketing, you will own online marketing programs that will enable us to exceed our acquisition targets, sales, margin, and overall goal achievement. You’ll also build strategies and oversee optimization and measurement of eater acquisition, cross-sell initiatives, and re marketing in order to deliver incremental sales, and enable consumer loyalty.

This person will be primarily responsible for scaling and accelerating user acquisition (of the right customers) at efficient CACs. User acquisition ignites the CookUnity flywheel enabling us to add more chefs to the platform which in turn add more variety of amazing dishes which drives happier customers with higher retention and virality. CookUnity has best in class retention in the category and this role will lead the set of strategies to accelerate the flywheel by scaling acquisition.

To stand out in a crowded category, CookUnity has found that chefs enable higher quality and much wider variety. We now want Marketing to leverage that differentiation in creating unique funnels for all the different segments of food lovers out there looking for a superior way of eating effortlessly.

Our ideal candidate is an expert in creating experimentation frameworks to leverage supply-demand optimization by building a content experimentation machine & hundreds landing pages. We’re not just looking for someone to run a playbook. Success for this role will be to help build the playbook. We are looking for a proactive leader, overseeing the strategy, planning, and execution of the growth marketing function.

Responsibilities:

  • Set up frameworks to create successful funnels leveraging our unique content (real chefs and widest variety). Design an acquisition mix that is truly user centric and where supply and demand meets.
  • Media buying to bring traffic that converts to new users that meet our growth targets.
  • Define and optimize paid media campaigns for customer acquisition across channels. Scaling proven channels and exploring new ones.
  • Monitor and optimize Payback period of each cohort of users making the necessary adjustments in quality of acquisition.
  • Lead the CRM team in developing and optimizing email and sms funnels.
  • Collaborate with the Brand Marketing team in creating all the necessary ownable content using our content studio in Brooklyn, NY.
  • Collaborate with the Brand Marketing team in pushing a cohesive positioning and storytelling across all channels and touchpoints.
  • Oversee the day-to-day tasks of the Growth Squad, in creating all the necessary landing pages and funnels.
  • Identify, test and scale new media formats and marketing approaches.
  • Partner closely with Branding, Product, Design, and Customer Experience to integrate customer marketing programs into all customer touchpoints.

Minimum Requirements:

  • 8+ years Marketing experience driving customer acquisition across marketing channels (PPC, Display, Paid Search, Paid Social, Retargeting, etc) at a DTC company - startup experience preferred
  • Has experience being part of a senior leadership team and thus has broader business competency beyond marketing
  • You worked at a company growing above $500M+ ARR and at 50%+ YoY for multiple years
  • Demonstrated ability to operate successfully in a time-sensitive and fast-paced environment. You have a dynamic and experimental approach to problem solving. You embrace a growth mindset to continually test assumptions
  • Experience demonstrating data insights (KPI’s, traffic, revenue, conversions, ROI) to improve marketing efforts
  • Proven experience building and executing direct and digital marketing campaigns for a business in a highly competitive and complex environment.
  • Personal passion for community and are motivated to encourage others by a deep connection to CookUnity's mission and core values

Preferred requirements:

  • Experience working with ad-serving platforms and digital monitoring tools, as well as offline marketing tools and strategies as well.
  • Understanding of the food-tech space
  • Has experience with and know how to work in Founder-run company.

Benefits:

•Bi-annual performance bonus

•We grow, you grow: Stock Options Plan granted on Day 1

•Health Insurance coverage

•401k Plan

•Unlimited PTO

• Family leave: 12 weeks for primary caregiver and 6 weeks for secondary caregiver, fully paid

•Compassionate Leave: 3-5 days each time the need arises

•A generous amount of CookUnity credits to enjoy our amazing meals, added to your account, monthly

•?•Wellness perks: access to a nutritional coach and fitness subsidies to build a healthy lifestyle

•?•Personalized Spanish coach

•Awesome opportunity to join a company that is looking to change how we eat and how chefs work!

Craving to learn more about us?

Click this link to learn more about our Community.

Compensation

All final pay rates will be determined by candidates experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.

job.title: Commercial Kitchen Refrigeration Service Technician
job.body:
SUMMARY

This position is responsible for providing world-class customer service in order to troubleshoot, diagnose and repair refrigeration (walk-in coolers, freezers, ice machines, etc) for our valued customers. As well as perform necessary preventative maintenance.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES (Includes the following but other duties may be assigned.)

  • Coordinate with management to assure consistency in our service strategy and execution. • Properly troubleshoots, diagnoses and repairs HVAC systems and refrigeration. • Defines service problems, collects data, establishes facts, and enters accurate information into ticketing system, as well as communicates effectively with manager
  • Performs preventative maintenance.
  • Follows safe work practices and accident prevention procedures
  • Maintains a neat and orderly facilities office, along with a good part and tool inventory. • Conduct yourself in accordance with the company handbook
  • Applicant can be cross trained in related fields to repair hot side equipment as well. • Complete service calls in a timely manner

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Relevant technical training, licenses, and/or certifications (i.e. EPA, CFESA) • Commercial refrigeration and/or commercial cooking equipment repair experience • Self-motivated with the proven ability prioritize and work independently

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

  • High school diploma or GED.
  • Two (2) years of education/experience in food service equipment repair or related area is a plus.
  • Background experience in gas, electricity, plumbing and/or steam repairs or a strong desire and willingness to learn/study quickly.
  • Strong experience in commercial refrigeration and HVAC.
  • Knowledge or experience of on computer systems and tablets or a strong desire and willingness to learn/study quickly.
  • Strong electrical, electronic, and mechanical aptitude with hands on experience Physical Requirements:
  • Ability to frequently kneel, bend, squat, push, pull, reach, and occasionally lift and carry up to 70 pounds
  • Ability to work with moving mechanical parts, pressurized steam equipment, open flames, heated surfaces, liquids, and risk of electrical shock in damp, humid, or freezing conditions • Ability to work on ladders, roofs, and in rare cases, high, precarious places

job.title: Customer Experience Supervisor
job.body:
What we're looking for

We are looking for a Customer Experience Supervisor with experience leading a customer support team, who is willing to improve our client's experience and leave a mark on their lives. The Customer Experience Supervisor is responsible for prioritizing and organizing all inbound requests from our customers, solving their issues, and providing an outstanding experience in every interaction. Our goal is to provide our customers with an impeccable experience, exceeding all expectations, not only with every shipment but every time people are in touch with us.

Our operations and subscribers are growing month to month. We're launching our second kitchen in Los Angeles so new challenges are yet to come. Not one day is alike in the Customer Experience Team. Being always on and having a customer-obsessed attitude are critical to achieving the best results in this role.

This role will report to the CX Manager.

Note: Our Kitchen Operations run from Friday to Wednesday. You will be assigned a schedule that may include evenings, weekends, or holidays. These schedules will be adjusted periodically to meet the needs of our business.

Responsibilities

  • Manage daily & weekly workflow, pace, and efficiency of the team.
  • Regularly check in with assigned teammates and monitor and evaluate performance.
  • Prioritize and organize the team tasks when the shift starts.
  • Handle critical cases and exceptions delivered by the CX Agents for proper follow-up, providing an outstanding experience in every interaction.
  • Identify and analyze problems within inbound conversations, team KPIs, & Ops issues and use data to find solutions.
  • Act as a liaison between market-level ops and the CX team to ensure customers are given timely service updates.
  • Help hire, train and manage Customer Support Agents, organizing their scheduled work shifts.
  • Run weekly standup meetings and provide updates on KPIs and study cases.
  • Develop deep expertise in our product, key differentiators, and the value it provides to our customers.
  • Help with miscellaneous projects and initiatives as they relate to CX OKRs.

Qualifications

  • You have at least 2+ years of experience handling inbound customer issue resolution using email, phone, and/or chat.
  • You have experience leading a customer support team, managing reports and organizing live queues.
  • You have an outstanding level of English (oral and written) and effective communication skills.
  • You are customer centric and love helping people.
  • You are very organized, even under pressure.
  • You have a data-driven mindset.
  • You have a positive attitude, great people skills, supportive and your are willing to go the extra mile for a team member.
  • Your North Stars are Quality and Empathy.
  • If you have knowledge of nutritional information and fine dining, we would love to speak with you!

Benefits

Get paid in USD, Crypto, Euro, or ARS. Whatever your choice! We use Deel to make things easier for you!

Work remotely: design the life that you want

Enjoy 15 business days of vacation each year from the start date.

Family leave of 12 weeks for the primary caregiver and 6 weeks for the secondary caregiver, fully paid

job.body:
SUMMARY

This position is responsible for providing world-class customer service in order to support the Site and Facility Manager with activities in internal maintenance and operations, accounting, vendor management, equipment and supplies, in order to build and maintain a high functioning food production facility.

job.body:

This is a unique opportunity to join a collaborative, growing CRM team that has real impact on business performance. You will be working alongside our CRM team, comprised of Director of CRM, Lifecycle Marketing Manager, and Lifecycle Marketing Associate. You will report directly to the Director of CRM.

The role:

The Lifecycle Marketing Coordinator will help support the CRM team to plan, implement, schedule, and execute timely email, SMS, push notification, and in app messages to our various audiences while collaborating with the CRM team on communication strategies, accurate execution of campaigns, and follow-up analysis.

Responsibilities:

job.title: Customer Experience Operations Specialist
job.body:
What we're looking for

At CookUnity, we are committed to delivering an exceptional customer experience. We're in search of a dedicated and talented Customer Experience Operations Specialist to help us build and elevate our best-in-class Customer Experience Operations. If you are someone with a background in Customer Service and a passion for optimizing processes and delivering outstanding customer satisfaction, we want to hear from you!

The Role

As a Customer Experience Operations Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of our customer experience processes. You will specialize in one of the following areas:

  • IT: Online experience
  • Finances: Disputes, Decline Credit cards, Conciliation, Credits & Refunds
  • Fulfillment: Replacements, order escalation, shipping exceptions
  • Logistics: Carriers, Drivers, delivery exceptions

In this role, you will leverage your tactical skills to execute daily operations while also employing your strategic thinking to identify issues and propose holistic solutions. Reporting directly to the Senior CX Operations Manager, you will be an essential part of our mission to provide operational excellence and unparalleled customer satisfaction.

Note: You will be assigned a schedule that includes evenings, weekends, and holidays.

Responsibilities

  • Swift Issue Resolution: Proactively address and resolve operational issues to minimize disruptions in daily operations.

  • Collaboration: Work closely with the CX team and Operations to ensure the dispatch and delivery of 100% of orders, fostering seamless communication and cooperation.

  • Data Management: Utilize basic Excel skills to track daily changes and manage customer communications effectively.

  • Logistics Coordination: Communicate with carriers to manage delivery delays, ensuring order accuracy and customer satisfaction.

  • Support: Assist the Logistics team with address verification and provide order status updates as needed.

  • Order Management: Handle order adjustments due to inventory shortages and discrepancies, maintaining order accuracy.

  • Process Improvement: Monitor incidents, provide valuable insights, and actively contribute to the continuous improvement of our operational processes.

  • Performance Tracking: Conduct audits and track performance metrics to drive continuous improvement efforts.

Qualifications

  • CX Experience: Minimum of 2 years of experience in a CX team, with at least 1 year focused on operations or marketplaces.

  • Proactive Problem Solver: A doer who excels at getting things done collaboratively across teams, with a natural problem-solving mindset.

  • Troubleshooting Expertise: Strong troubleshooting skills, comfortable handling complex issues.

  • Attention to Detail: Exceptional attention to detail and outstanding organizational skills.

  • Team Player: Enjoy working in a team and thrive in a fast-paced startup environment.

  • Bilingual Proficiency: Fluent in both English and Spanish.

Benefits

Get paid in USD, Crypto, Euro, or ARS. Whatever your choice! We use Deel to make things easier for you!

Work remotely: design the life that you want

Enjoy 15 business days of vacation each year from start date.

Family leave: 12 weeks for primary caregiver and 6 weeks for secondary caregiver, fully paid

Personalized English coach

job.title: Bilingual Receiving Warehouse Manager
job.body:
CookUnity is the first Chef-Direct Subscription service—a chef-to-food lover marketplace connecting the country's most talented chefs with eaters (consumers). We’re changing meal delivery by bringing small-batch, restaurant-quality meals to eaters across the country. Every week, a diverse collective of all-star chefs craft their signature, ready-to-eat dishes for an elevated at-home dining experience.

CookUnity is home to more than 50 of NYC and LA, Austin, Atlanta, Miami, Seattle & Chicago most inspired and innovative chefs. Through a weekly subscription, eaters can select from a diverse, ever-changing menu of hundreds of hand-crafted meals. Our chefs create dishes that cater to a wide variety of palates and dietary preferences, so the best part of dining out can be enjoyed by everyone.

Delivering more than 3.5M meals per year and growing 5x YoY, CookUnity is also helping improve the livelihood of working chefs, doubling their income, enabling the growth of their own teams and personal brands. And believing that healthy food fuels stronger communities, CookUnity partners with Food Bank For New York City, the city’s major hunger-relief organization, working to end food insecurity across all five boroughs.

A growing startup with kitchens in Brooklyn, Los Angeles, Chicago, Atlanta, Seattle, Miami & Austin, CookUnity reaches subscribers throughout the country.

Join Us!

Responsibilities:

  • Operational Improvements: ownership of the delta between theoretical and actual food spend in assigned Marketplace
    • Establish & implement standardized ingredient-receiving practices at the location to ensure the efficiency and freshness of ingredients
    • Review site layouts to develop optimal storage and handling of ingredients
    • Focus on the “Distribution Model” deployment across all food categories (Protein, Produce, Dairy, and select Dry Goods) and markets
  • Develop and ensure ongoing compliance with the process for checking incoming shipments versus invoices and order sheets.
  • Train Market teams to ensure that they have the skills required to successfully manage our ingredient needs.
    • Provide staffing coverage for Marketplace teams as needed
  • Processes to focus on and implement:
    • Receiving
    • Inventory Counting
    • Ordering
    • Food Safety Compliance (HACCP)
  • Continuous oversight of inventory to ensure optimal levels of product
  • Ensure all product is logged, stored, and neatly organized taking into account FIFO and food safety standards
  • Train the Market's teams in order to ensure they count on the skills and criteria required for their tasks, including HACCP guidelines
  • Refine receiving and cold chain procedures to ensure efficiency and freshness of ingredients.
  • Scheduling of Marketplace and receiving team, according to the labor budget.
  • Any other marketplace tasks based on business needs.

Qualifications:

  • Bilingual (English / Spanish)
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role, such as management of a Grocery store, warehouse, or procurement department experience
  • Experience in food procurement and extensive food knowledge
  • Experience in inventory management
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented
  • Understanding of food safety and quality standards
  • Ability to train and inspire employees to perform at their best
  • Ability to communicate and understand Spanish

Benefits:

  • Health Insurance coverage
  • PTO & Paid sick days
  • 401K
  • Compassionate, Caregiver, or Bereavement Leave: 3 – 5 days each time the need arises.
  • Parental Leave: 12 weeks at full pay for primary caregiver and 4 weeks for secondary caregiver
  • Access to a nutritional coach to help you build a healthy lifestyle
  • A generous amount of CookUnity credits to enjoy our amazing meals added to your account, monthly

Compensation

All final pay rates will be determined by candidates experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.

Pay Range for this position

$60,000—$80,000 USD

If you’re interested in this role, please submit your application and if we think you might be a fit, we'll get in touch with you. Thank you for your time!

job.title: Social Media & Content Lead
job.body:
About the Team:

At CookUnity, the Brand Marketing team is responsible for developing and executing world-class marketing activations that drive brand awareness and earn loyalty beyond reason. Brand Marketing sets the vision and strategy for the brand and brings it to life with strategic rigor, creative excellence, and cultural relevance. Through insight-inspired, data-informed brand storytelling and experiences, CookUnity’s Brand Marketing team will build a category-defining brand loved by an entire generation of foodies.

The Role

We are looking for an ambitious creator to help us supercharge CookUnity’s social media and lead our brand into a new era of more strategic, creative, real-time audience engagement. This role will be tasked with driving organic content creation and needs to be experienced executing from strategy through shooting, editing, posting, and engaging.

You are social obsessed, fluent in the language of the internet, and have your finger squarely on the pulse of culture. We are looking for someone who is entrepreneurial, proactive, and LOVES to create. You are equally comfortable developing a strategic plan and reporting performance analytics as you are generating ideas, executing creative, and acting as the voice of the CookUnity brand in social channels. In this exciting role, you will play a central role in all brand initiatives and help make CookUnity a content powerhouse and category defining brand.

You will report to the Brand Marketing Director and work closely with partners throughout the company.

Responsibilities

  • Set the vision and strategy for CookUnity across key social channels including a strategic POV for translating our brand essence into social.
  • Develop innovative, attention grabbing concepts that will drive awareness and engage our audience at the speed of culture.
  • Ideate, plan, and execute organic content and assets tailor made for social media and leveraging the latest formats and trends to maximize reach and relevance.
  • Post the content you create using best practices and optimization tactics to maximize performance, follower acquisition, and overall audience engagement.
  • Comment, reply, and manage DMs across all active social media channels and emerging channels as they are integrated into our strategy.
  • Report performance analytics and surface meaningful insights to demonstrate impact, inform future content, and inspire future marketing initiatives.
  • Collaborate with high profile chefs both in studio and out in the world to create immersive food content and tell captivating human stories.
  • Partner with Creative Studio and key stakeholders to capture organic content at all major photoshoots.
  • Collaborate closely with the paid social team to create a cohesive brand presence and highly effective acquisition engine.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Proficient in the nuances of social content creation and know the specs, native features, best practices, hacks, and tricks to producing high quality, high performing content
  • Data driven and always leveraging insights to inform creative decisions
  • Proficient in all major creative software for photo and video editing
  • A highly detail oriented multi-tasker with a strong eye for creative
  • An excellent written communicator with the ability to speak the language of the internet fluently as one of the most public facing voices of the brand
  • Excited to be on-the-go and willing to travel (locally and otherwise) to capture timely, relevant content live and IRL
  • Open to and comfortable possibly being on camera and/or lending your voice to CookUnity’s social content
  • Aware of the always-on environment of social media and ready to engage in realtime as relevant conversations, moments, and/or cultural opportunities arise

Benefits

•Health Insurance coverage.

• PTO policy and paid sick days.

• We grow, you grow: Stock Options Plan granted on Day 1.

•401k Plan.

• Family leave: 12 weeks for primary caregiver and 6 weeks for secondary caregiver, fully paid.

• Compassionate Leave: 3-5 days each time the need arises.

• A generous amount of CookUnity credits to enjoy our amazing meals, added to your account, monthly.

•?• Wellness perks: access to a nutritional coach and fitness subsidies to build a healthy lifestyle.

•?• Personalized Spanish coach.

• Awesome opportunity to join a company that is looking to change how we eat and how chefs work!

Compensation

All final pay rates will be determined by candidates experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.

Pay Range for this position

$113,000—$130,000 USD

If you’re interested in this role, please submit your application and if we think you might be a fit, we'll get in touch with you. Thank you for your time!

job.body:
About the Team:

At CookUnity, the Brand Marketing team is responsible for developing and executing world-class marketing activations that drive brand awareness and earn loyalty beyond reason. Brand Marketing sets the vision and strategy for the brand and brings it to life with strategic rigor, creative excellence, and cultural relevance. Through insight-inspired, data-informed brand storytelling and experiences, CookUnity’s Brand Marketing team will build a category-defining brand loved by an entire generation of foodies.

The Role

We are looking for an ambitious Brand Marketing leader to elevate the craft of marketing and fuel brand growth by partnering cross-functionally to create seamless brand experiences between marketing, product, portfolio, and our community of world-class independent chefs.

You will help shape a brand strategy that elevates and differentiates the CookUnity brand and bring that strategy to life with exceptional creative work that earns a disproportionate share of cultural conversation. With responsibility for brand strategy, consumer insights, social media, brand partnerships, and integrated campaigns, this is an essential leadership role.

You will report to the VP of Brand Marketing and work closely with influential leaders throughout the company.

job.title: Commercial Kitchen Equipment Service Technician
job.body:
SUMMARY

This position is responsible for providing world-class customer service in order to troubleshoot, diagnose and repair commercial food equipment and appliances (grills, ovens, skillets, fryers, etc)

OR refrigeration (walk-in coolers, freezers, ice machines, etc) for our valued customers.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES (Includes the following but other duties may be assigned.)

  • Coordinate with management to assure consistency in our service strategy and execution.

  • Properly troubleshoots, diagnoses and repairs commercial food equipment and appliances, HVAC systems and refrigeration.

  • Defines service problems, collects data, establishes facts, and enters accurate information into ticketing system, as well as communicates effectively with manager

  • Follows safe work practices and accident prevention procedures

  • Maintains a neat and orderly facilities office, along with a good part and tool inventory.

  • Conduct yourself in accordance with the company handbook

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • Relevant technical training, licenses, and/or certifications (i.e. EPA, CFESA)

  • Commercial refrigeration and/or commercial cooking equipment repair experience

  • Self-motivated with the proven ability prioritize and work independently

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

  • High school diploma or GED.

  • Two (2) years of education/experience in food service equipment repair or related area is a plus.

  • Background experience in gas, electricity, plumbing and/or steam repairs or a strong desire and willingness to learn/study quickly.

  • Strong experience in commercial HVAC and refrigeration is a plus.

  • Knowledge or experience of on computer systems and tablets or a strong desire and willingness to learn/study quickly.

  • Strong mechanical aptitude with hands on experience

Physical Requirements:

  • Ability to frequently kneel, bend, squat, push, pull, reach, and occasionally lift and carry up to 70 pounds

  • Ability to work with moving mechanical parts, pressurized steam equipment, open flames, heated surfaces, liquids, and risk of electrical shock in damp, humid, or freezing conditions

  • Ability to work on ladders, roofs, and in rare cases, high, precarious places

Compensation

All final pay rates will be determined by candidates experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.

job.title: Creator Development Leader
job.body:
At CookUnity, the role of the Creator Development Leader (CDL) transcends conventional boundaries. It's a unique confluence of business development, account management, marketing, and creator engagement within our vibrant ecosystem. As a CDL, you're more than just a liaison – you're the embodiment of CookUnity's mission, values, and culinary community. You're positive, self-motivated, and driven by a relentless spirit. Your independence and proactive approach set you apart. A blend of creativity and analytical prowess empowers you to engineer breakthrough results. Your communication is exceptional, whether crafting concise recommendations for senior leadership or forging instant connections with people.

The role:

As the face of CookUnity to food creators worldwide, you're a trailblazer in the Chef Success account team. A growth-driven team that's passionate about bringing food entrepreneurs into our marketplace, nurturing their achievements, and satisfying our eaters.

Responsibilities:

I. Guiding the Full Creator Journey at CookUnity

  • You're an advocate for food creators, chefs, and culinary entrepreneurs of all sizes, sharing the CookUnity story with passion.
  • Building genuine relationships with creators, ensuring their experience is nothing short of exceptional, fostering loyalty and platform credibility.
  • Orchestrating the creation and execution of comprehensive account plans, partnering with department leaders to deliver on priorities vital to creator success.
  • Ensuring the profitability of both CookUnity and creators by driving proactive initiatives, managing projects, cultivating relationships, and optimizing performance.
  • Leading the development of insights, translating outcomes into actionable strategies for portfolios and brands.
  • Pioneering fresh strategies that boost revenue, ensuring CookUnity's marketplace remains competitive.
  • Fostering a sense of community among our chefs and their fans, amplifying connections.

II. Weaving Collaborative Bonds with Internal Teams

  • Nurturing a culture of proactive experimentation, exploring novel ideas to elevate both account value and business growth.
  • Serving as a pivotal bridge between key account teams and CookUnity's internal functions, including marketing, finance, operations, and more.
  • Igniting best practice sharing and insights across the Chef Success team, offering innovative ideas, constructive feedback on tools and processes, and identifying opportunities for enhancement.
  • Mastering communication and coordination across accounts and internal teams, from facilitating account meetings to driving account communications.
  • Shaping team and company culture, embodying CookUnity's Mission and Core Values.

Minimum Requirements:

  • 2-5+ years of experience in a professional services firm with a background in account management and client development; preference for a consulting background.
  • Proficiency in negotiating, structuring, and successfully closing deals.
  • Ability to communicate complex concepts in a manner that is easily comprehensible.
  • Ownership mentality in maintaining workflow and consistently meeting deadlines, driven by an entrepreneurial spirit.
  • Strong commercial acumen, capable of effectively managing and fostering revenue growth.
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate account challenges to internal stakeholders, regardless of their competency, and connect these discussions to tangible business outcomes.
  • Comfortable with direct client interactions, conveying information clearly and confidently.
  • Proficient in using Excel and PowerPoint, showcasing a solid grasp of computer literacy and numerical proficiency.
  • Ability to effectively collaborate within a team environment, defining issues, proposing hypotheses, conducting complex analyses, and contributing to solution recommendations.
  • Willingness to work within a geographically distributed team structure, thriving in an exceptionally fast-paced and demanding environment.

Preferred requirements:

  • Prior experience in a consulting role, enriching account management and client development expertise.
  • Adept at traveling up to 20% of the time for client engagement, conferences, and representing CookUnity.
  • Exceptional storytelling skills, with the ability to captivate and convince through credible narratives.
  • Proven track record of driving account growth in large-scale, complex environments.
  • Familiarity with managing cross-geography account relationships, exhibiting strong interpersonal skills.
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint, highlighting a high level of computer literacy.
  • Comfortable working with confidential/sensitive information, and exercising sound judgment.
  • Effectively navigates and collaborates with diverse levels and functions within the organization.

job.title: Partner Acquisition Lead
job.body:
We're in search of a dynamic recruitment lead to champion new chef partners, provide vital administrative support to team stakeholders, and spearhead the onboarding of leads throughout our partner acquisition process. As the ambassador of CookUnity, you'll be the charismatic face and voice of our brand, effectively communicating the prowess of our marketplace. If you thrive in change, excel at managing shifting priorities, and are always ready to step up, both within your department and across projects, then our growing startup atmosphere is your perfect match!

The role:

Our ideal candidate is a creative, motivated self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit, ideally rooted in the food industry. This role is pivotal in building a robust candidate pool for our platform, aligning with both quantitative and qualitative recruitment targets. Your success hinges on your ability to track outreach across various lead generation channels, assess candidate potential and market fit, and devise innovative strategies for attracting, vetting, and nurturing a pipeline of organic partner candidates.

A strong grasp of the food service and restaurant industry is a major plus. Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, are essential. The right fit is outgoing, unrestricted in their thinking, and possesses a business-development mindset with a knack for solutions. You should be motivated by the desire to empower Chefs in their journey of growing their businesses on the CU platform, driven by a genuine passion for culinary arts!

On a daily basis, your tasks will include conducting introductory video calls, updating our CRM, cultivating a lead database, and reporting to internal stakeholders.

This is a 90-day contract role with the potential to transition into a full-time position.

Responsibilities:

  • Originate new partner leads
  • Develop an in-depth understanding of our business model and its partner potential
  • Enhance the efficiency of Chef partner acquisition and retention workflows
  • Utilize social platforms to heighten brand awareness on a local level
  • Foster clear communication across internal and external teams
  • Design systems for organizing applicants, matching them to roles, and prioritizing based on diverse criteria
  • Collaborate with onsite teams to amplify excitement about joining CookUnity’s platform
  • Keep current with industry trends, US-based chefs, and hospitality groups

Minimum Requirements:

  • A minimum of 2 years of experience in business development, partner acquisition, grassroots marketing, or recruitment.
  • Proven track record in effectively pitching new partnership opportunities.
  • Some knowledge of commercial and large-scale kitchen operations.
  • Superior planning, communication, time management, and organizational skills.
  • Experience with G-Suite and recruitment or project management tools and CRMs.
  • Ability to work well in the fast-paced environment of our quickly growing business.
  • Attitude: Demonstrate passion and enthusiasm for the brand; be a collaborative, positive team player.
  • Execution: Maintain high standards for quality and speed, adept at problem-solving.
  • Ability to excel with autonomy in an ambiguous environment.
  • Outstanding communication and organizational skills. Conversational English proficiency is required.

Preferred requirements:

  • Additional years of experience in business development, partner acquisition, grassroots marketing, or recruitment.
  • Strong proficiency in pitching and securing new partnership opportunities.
  • In-depth knowledge of commercial and large-scale kitchen operations.
  • Proficiency in using G-Suite and recruitment or project management tools and CRMs.
  • Proven ability to adapt and excel in a rapidly changing business landscape.
  • Strong growth mindset demonstrated through leveraging past learnings and promoting innovative ideas and calculated risk-taking for personal and team development.

Benefits

job.title: Platform Director
job.body:
About the Team

The Platform Team leads foundational technology at CookUnity, ensuring stability, scalability, and security. Within the Platform team, there are several sub-teams, including QA, Product Support, Infrastructure, and Core.

The role

As the Platform Director, you will be a key member of our engineering leadership team, reporting directly to the VP of Engineering.

Your primary responsibility will be to lead and shape our platform strategy, overseeing its development, deployment, and maintenance. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Product, Engineering, and Operations, to ensure our platform aligns with business goals, technological advancements, and market demands.

Responsibilities:

  • Define and execute the long-term vision and roadmap for the company's platform, considering both technical and business aspects.
  • Address technical challenges across the platform.
  • Prioritize system uptime and ensure teams are prepared for any technical disruptions.
  • Lead the Core, Infrastructure, QA, and Product Support teams fostering innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
  • Oversee the design, development, testing, and deployment of platform components, ensuring high performance, security, and reliability.
  • Work closely with the product engineering teams to ensure seamless platform operation, including monitoring, incident response, and scalability planning.
  • Evaluate emerging technologies and industry trends to make informed decisions on platform architecture and tooling.
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with external partners, vendors, and third-party integrators.
  • Establish and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure platform success and drive data-driven decision-making.
  • Manage the platform resource allocation and project timelines effectively.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Comfortable in a dynamic startup environment.
  • Proven experience (at least 8 years) in software development, with a focus on platform architecture and engineering.
  • Strong leadership skills with a track record of managing and mentoring technical teams.
  • Experience in architecting and managing large-scale technology systems.
  • Deep understanding of modern software development methodologies, service-oriented architecture, and cloud technologies.
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities, able to navigate complex technical challenges.
  • Exceptional communication skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and present ideas to executive leadership.
  • Experience with agile development practices and project management tools.
  • Proficiency with testing processes, deployment procedures, and backend integrations.
  • Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools for continuous integration and deployment.
  • Strong communication skills in English.

Preferred requirements:

  • Previous experience as a Director of Platform or similar leadership roles.
  • Knowledge of security best practices in platform design and maintenance.
  • Understanding of data analytics and its integration into platform features.
  • Strong business acumen and ability to align technical decisions with strategic goals.

job.title: Infrastructure Engineer
job.body:
The role

We are seeking a skilled Infrastructure Engineer to manage our infrastructure and ensure the efficient operation of our systems. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining our infrastructure and applications to optimize productivity, reduce downtime, and enhance security.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement containerization strategies using Docker to achieve isolated environments and improve application portability.
  • Develop and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform, Terragrunt, and Terratest for automated infrastructure deployment and management.
  • Manage Kubernetes clusters and EKS environments to ensure efficient scaling and high availability of our applications.
  • Implement and manage Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines for efficient and reliable software delivery.
  • Develop and maintain automated deployment and rollback strategies to minimize downtime and ensure seamless software releases.
  • Manage databases and implement decentralized database migrations to ensure data integrity and reliability.
  • Implement and maintain infrastructure security measures to ensure our systems' confidentiality, integrity, and availability.
  • Develop and maintain infrastructure monitoring and alerting systems to proactively detect and resolve issues before they impact our services.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Strong Infrastructure as Code (IaC) knowledge and experience with tools such as Terraform, Terragrunt, and Terratest.
  • Extensive experience with containerization technologies such as Docker.
  • Experience with Kubernetes and EKS to manage containerized applications at scale.
  • Experience with database management and decentralized database migrations.
  • Proficiency in implementing and managing CI/CD pipelines to achieve efficient software delivery.

Preferred requirements:

  • Knowledge of infrastructure security best practices and experience in implementing security measures.
  • Experience with infrastructure monitoring and alerting tools to proactively detect and resolve issues.

job.title: Inbound Receiving Associate
job.body:
Who we are

CookUnity is the first ever chef-to-consumer platform. Connecting a diverse group of talented chefs with busy food lovers, we're elevating the at-home dining experience.

We are growing rapidly and looking for hard-working, passionate team members that will help us become more efficient, faster, and reliable to our customers.

We are always learning and growing – if this sounds like an environment where you would thrive, we'd love to hear from you

Tasks:

  • Receive shipments, check for damages and sort stock for distribution in the market/warehouse
  • Keep record of invoices sent and received
  • Fill orders by taking items from the warehouse and prepare them for delivery to chefs
  • Keep track record of chefs ingredient requirements and returns
  • Monitor shelves and fill them in when needed
  • Keep up with the movement of merchandise in the store and warehouse
  • Weekly counting of assigned inventory

Qualifications

  • Must be at least 18 years old
  • High School Diploma or GED
  • You are eligible to work in the U.S.
  • Bilingual English/Spanish, preferred
  • Must be familiar with FIFO and food safety regulations
  • You are reliable: punctual and regular attendance is required — changing the way the world eats and chef work takes heart and discipline!
  • Ability to operate a pallet jack is helpful but not required
  • Experience working in a food facility is helpful but not required
  • Able to stand or walk for 8 hour shifts and carry up to 50 pounds
  • Occasionally may be required to work in a cold refrigerated area kept at 35 degrees

Benefits:

  • Competitive hourly rates
  • Complimentary gym on property (Peloton, free weights, Hydro rower, and more!)
  • Lunch served daily
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • Full-time, Part-time, and Overnight positions available

job.title: Marketplace Supervisor - Austin
job.body:
What we're looking for

We're building our team in Austin that will help us become more efficient, faster, and reliable to our customers. We're looking for a hard-working, passionate Supervisor who values transparency, communication, and collaboration. We are always learning and growing – if this sounds like an environment where you would thrive, we’d love to hear from you!

The Role

The Marketplace Supervisor is to help support the onsite Culinary or Marketplace Manager in handling day to day operations. This individual needs to be able to take the bull by the horns and lead the team to execute operational SOP’s both effectively and efficiently. This includes, but not limited to, handling receiving, inventory, storing and distributing all products within the Marketplace. In addition, this individual will be responsible for purchasing ingredients and scheduling staff.

Responsibilities:

  • Operate pallet jack to move pallets of product
  • Processes to focus on and implement:
    • Receiving
    • Inventory Counting
    • Ordering
    • Returns

  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned by leaders

  • Enforcement of food safety standards and FIFO methods to ensure the freshness of food

Qualifications:

job.title: Accounting Manager
job.body:
About the role

We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Accounting Manager to join our team in a remote capacity. As an Accounting Manager, you will work closely with Market Directors, the Supply Chain Team, Product Team, Engineering and Data Team contributing to cross-functional collaborations.

Responsibilities

Accounting Operations Management:

  • Oversee and manage the day-to-day accounting operations, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and compliance with accounting principles and company policies.
  • Review and approve journal entries, reconciliations, and other financial transactions prepared by the accounting team.
  • Monitor and maintain general ledger accounts, ensuring proper recording and classification of transactions related to inventories, cost of goods sold (COGS), and other relevant accounts.
  • Coordinate with external auditors during annual audits and assist in providing necessary documentation and explanations.

Netsuite and Inventory Management Software Implementation:

  • Play a key role in the implementation of Netsuite and the Inventory Management software.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Supply Chain, Product, Engineering and Data, to ensure seamless integration and proper configuration of systems.
  • Identify and communicate finance-related requirements and needs for the successful implementation of the software.
  • Assist in the design and implementation of inventory valuation methodologies and controls within the system.

Inventory Management and Cost Control:

  • Oversee the management of large inventories, including inventory valuation, costing methodologies, and physical inventory counts coordination.
  • Collaborate with the Supply Chain Team and the Accounts Payable Team to ensure accurate and timely recording of inventory transactions including purchase orders, receipts and adjustments.
  • Implement and monitor internal controls related to inventory management and cost control to safeguard assets and prevent fraud.

Financial Reporting and Analysis:

  • Prepare timely and accurate financial reports including weekly and monthly financial statements.
  • Assist in the preparation of forecasts and other financial projections.

Team Leadership and Development:

  • Supervise and mentor a team of accounting professionals, providing guidance, training, and performance feedback.
  • Coordinate the weekly and monthly close processes, ensuring adherence to deadlines and accuracy of financial statements.
  • Foster a collaborative and positive work environment, promoting teamwork and professional growth within the team.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or a related field.
  • Strong knowledge of accounting principles, inventory valuation, and cost accounting methodologies.
  • Excellent understanding of financial statements, internal controls, and GAAP.
  • Proficient in financial analysis and the ability to interpret complex financial data.
  • Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to mentor and motivate a team.
  • Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, to collaborate with cross-functional teams and senior management.
  • Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.
  • Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and remotely.

Preferred Requirements:

  • Experience as an Accounting Manager in a retail or mid-size company with a focus on large inventories is a plus.
  • Experience in implementing or working with Netsuite and Inventory Management software is highly desirable.

Benefits

• Get paid in USD, Crypto, Euro, ARS. Whatever your choice! We use Deel to make things easier for you!

•Work remotely: design the life that you want.

•Enjoy 15 days of vacation each year from the start date.

•Wellness benefit: Gympass subscription, a well-being platform that offers the best coverage of top gyms, studios, and activities for you to choose from.

job.title: Customer Experience Specialist
job.body:
What we're looking for

We are looking for a Customer Experience Specialist with experience in customer support, who wants to improve our client's experience and leave a mark on their lives.

The Role

The main role is helping customers understand the product, answering questions, clearing up doubts about our meals and service, and solving day-to-day issues, making each of them feel unique and heard. You’ll be part of an exciting, growing team designed to take our support to the next level.

Our operations and subscribers are growing month to month. We're launching our second kitchen in Los Angeles so new challenges are yet to come. Not one day is alike in the Customer Experience Team, and most of the time you'll be handling different cases that require time-sensitive responses. Always on and a customer-obsessed attitude are critical to achieving the best results in this role.

Note: You will be assigned a schedule that may include evenings, weekends, or holidays. These schedules will be adjusted periodically to meet the needs of our business.

Responsibilities

  • Handle all inbound requests from our customers and solve their issues providing an outstanding experience in every interaction
  • Address time-sensitive issues, such as payments, account questions, delivery issues, or troubleshooting by email or chat in a timely manner
  • Assist clients with any and all questions and concerns regarding their subscription, product, and service overall
  • Escalate critical cases and exceptions to CS Supervisor for proper follow up
  • Process orders, forms, applications, and general subscription requests
  • Develop a deep expertise in our product, key differentiators, and the value it provides to our customers

Qualifications

  • You have at least 3+ years of experience handling inbound customer issue resolution using email, phone, and/or chat.
  • You have an outstanding level of English (oral and written) and effective communication skills
  • You are customer centric and love helping people
  • You are very organized, even under pressure
  • You have a positive attitude, great people skills, supportive and your are willing to go the extra mile for a team member
  • Your North Stars are Quality and Empathy
  • If you have knowledge of nutritional information and fine dining, we would love to speak with you!

Benefits

Get paid in USD, Crypto, Euro, ARS. Whatever your choice! We use Deel to make things easier for you!

Work remotely: design the life that you want

Enjoy 15 business days of vacation each year from start date.

Family leave: 12 weeks for primary caregiver and 6 weeks for secondary caregiver, fully paid

Compassionate Leave: 3-5 days each time the need arises

Personalized English coach

If you are required to report to work on any of the selected National Holidays (ARG) you’ll be paid double your normal daily rate.

job.title: Join our Talent Community!
job.body:
Hi there

We're so glad to hear that you're interested in working with us. If you don't see an available position that matches your background, don't worry. We're always growing, and there's a good chance that a role that suits your skillset will become available in the future. So please, send us your resume, and we'll reach out to you as soon as we can.

By completing this application, you'll be added to our pool of applicants and considered for current and future opportunities. If we come across a position that matches your background, we'll definitely be in touch. However, please note that submitting this application is not the same as submitting a direct job application. So if you come across a specific job that catches your eye, please don't hesitate to apply directly for that role. We can't wait to hear from you and explore the possibility of working together!

Thank you for your interest in CookUnity!

If you’re interested in this role, please submit your application and if we think you might be a fit, we'll get in touch with you. Thank you for your time!

CookUnity is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are dedicated to creating a community of inclusion and an environment free from discrimination or harassment. job.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer, Chef Tech Squad
job.body:
About the role

We're always open and interested to meet amazingly talented Engineers that love what they do and are excited to share the projects they're into. We know that joining a startup is not only about hard skills. It's also about the right timing, understanding that, more often than not, a rolling-up-your-sleeves attitude is what it takes to make things done, but most important of all you have a strong desire to make an impact in other people's lives.

So if you think you are ready to dive in, let's move forward. And if you don't, but you're interested in learning what the future means to us let's move forward too!

Some of the best Chefs in America will be your close collaborators! Not only CookUnity's "rising stars" but also the well-known Chefs we've partnered with this year as part of our Creators Club (Pierre Thiam, Esther Choi, JJ Johnson, Ali Maffucci, Marc Forgione, Einat Admony, and more!).

We are looking for a solid cross-language Full Stack Engineer, with a cloud architecture vision that helps us build and maintain all of the tools and processes required to turn chef-designed meals from an idea into cooked meals.

Your Team - Chef Tech

The goal of the Chef Tech Team is to bring the best experience possible for the CookUnity chefs by making their journey easier to create their meals and make decisions about future meals.

Our team owns the end-to-end digital experience that enables Chefs to view insights on their meals and guides them to make specific adjustments and recommendations based on eater demands. Additionally, with the Chefs being our primary users for our squad, we are constantly building features based on their feedback and needs to cook the best meals for our eaters.

This is our current stack:

Languages: Javascript
Backend: NodeJS, NestJS, Express, PHP (Only API), Typescript
Front end :ReactJS, React-Router , React-Query, Tailwindcss, React-hook-Form, Yup,
Database: MySQL y PostgresSQL.
Infrastructure: AWS Based: Docker, Kubernets, S3.
CI/CD: we use GitLab pipelines for automatic deployments, we are starting to use automated testing and in the near future we are about to implement static code analyzers.(editado)

Agile Methodology

You're a great fit because you...

  • are detail-oriented and care deeply about delivering small or large features with exceptional quality.
  • can effectively balance resolving critical issues with making fundamental strategic investments.
  • working and developing things from scratch
  • have a growth mindset and believe in setting ambitious goals and learning from both success and failure.
  • are highly independent
  • enjoy the pace and ownership that comes with a startup environment
  • enjoy being part of a multidisciplinary team

Responsibilities

Here are some of the things you’ll help us with:

  • Design and implement platform features, within our Javascript stack, that engages customers and has a meaningful impact on people’s lives.
  • Iterating on new and existing features to improve user experience and performance.
  • Actively contribute to the adoption of strong software architecture, development best practices, and new technologies.
  • Improving the maturity of our technical stack with engineering best practices.
  • Being part of the code review process and helping to mentor other engineers.
  • Contribute technically to projects by being a hands-on coder, removing roadblocks, and repairing technical issues.

Qualifications

  • You have experience designing and building cloud architecture, backends, middle ends, web apps, basically the whole combo!
  • You understand how to interact with and build backend REST APIs.
  • You have an advance level of English
  • You enjoy working in small teams in a fast-paced startup environment.
  • You have at least +5yrs of experience as a Software Engineer and you can engage with projects in React/NodeJS and TypeScript.
  • You're proficient in relational database management.
  • Experience working with Docker/Kubernetes/CI environments.

Benefits

• Get paid in USD, Crypto, Euro, ARS. Whatever your choice! We use Deel to make things easier for you!
• Work remotely: design the life that you want.
• Enjoy 15 days of vacation each year from start date.
• 16 fully paid Argentinean holidays.
?? Get a MacBookAir (upgraded version).
• Family leave: 12 weeks for primary caregiver and 6 weeks for secondary caregiver, fully paid.
• Compassionate Leave: 3-5 days each time the need arises.
•?• Personalized English coach

If you’re interested in this role, please submit your application and if we think you might be a fit, we'll get in touch with you. Thank you for your time!
