job.title: Accounting Payable Analyst
job.body:
The Role:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Accounts Payable Analyst to join our fast-growing company in a remote position. As an Accounts Payable Analyst, you will play a vital role in managing the payment process for vendor invoices, ensuring accurate and timely processing. You will be responsible for verifying invoice accuracy, matching invoices with approved budgets, handling payment disbursements, reconciling vendor statements, resolving payment discrepancies, and maintaining strong relationships with vendors. Additionally, you will manage credit cards, ensure compliance with expense policies (including travel expenses and meals & entertainment budget), create new vendors, answer credit applications, and provide a weekly summary of the status to C-level executives

Key Responsibilities:

  • Invoice Management and Payment Processing:

    • Receive and review vendor invoices for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with company policies.
    • Match invoices with approved budgets, purchase orders, and receiving documentation.
    • Ensure proper coding and documentation of expenses.
    • Process payments promptly, adhering to payment terms and company policies.
    • Maintain accurate records of payments made and update vendor accounts accordingly.

    Vendor Reconciliation and Relationship Management:

    • Reconcile vendor statements with accounts payable records to ensure accuracy and resolve any discrepancies.
    • Communicate and collaborate with vendors to address payment inquiries and resolve payment-related issues promptly.
    • Establish and maintain strong relationships with vendors to facilitate efficient payment processing and vendor management.

    Credit Card Management and Expense Policy Compliance:

    • Monitor and manage company credit cards, ensuring compliance with expense policies and budget guidelines.
    • Review employee expense reports, verifying expenses against policy guidelines and budget allocations.
    • Communicate and enforce expense policies, providing guidance and support to employees as needed.
    • Collaborate with the Finance team to ensure accurate and timely reimbursement of employee expenses.

    Vendor Onboarding and Credit Applications:

    • Create new vendor accounts in the accounting system, ensuring accurate and up-to-date information.
    • Review and respond to vendor credit applications, conducting credit checks as necessary.
    • Collaborate with the Purchasing and Legal teams to ensure compliance with vendor onboarding procedures and requirements.

    Reporting and Communication:

    • Prepare and distribute weekly summaries of accounts payable status to C-level executives, highlighting key metrics and issues.
    • Generate reports on accounts payable activities, including outstanding invoices, payment schedules, and vendor performance.
    • Communicate effectively with internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams to address inquiries, provide updates, and facilitate process improvements.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or a related field.
  • Strong knowledge of accounting principles, inventory valuation, and cost accounting methodologies.
  • Excellent understanding of financial statements, internal controls, and GAAP.
  • Proficient in financial analysis and the ability to interpret complex financial data.
  • Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to mentor and motivate a team.
  • Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, to collaborate with cross-functional teams and senior management.
  • Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.
  • Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and remotely.

Preferred Requirements:

  • Experience as an Accounting Manager in a retail or mid-size company with a focus on large inventories is a plus.
  • Experience in implementing or working with Netsuite and Inventory Management software is highly desirable.

Benefits:

• Get paid in USD, Crypto, Euro, ARS. Whatever your choice! We use Deel to make things easier for you!

•Work remotely: design the life that you want.

•Enjoy 15 days of vacation each year from the start date.

•Wellness benefit: Gympass subscription, a well-being platform that offers the best coverage of top gyms, studios, and activities for you to choose from.

• Monthly Meal Credits.

• 16 fully paid Argentinian holidays.

•Family leave of 12 weeks for the primary caregiver and six weeks for the secondary caregiver, fully paid.

•Compassionate Leave: 3-5 days each time the need arises.

•?•Personalized English coach

If you’re interested in this role, please submit your application and if we think you might be a fit, we'll get in touch with you. Thank you for your time!

CookUnity is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are dedicated to creating a community of inclusion and an environment free from discrimination or harassment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status, protected veteran status, genetic information, or physical or mental disability.

job.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer, Activation Squad
job.body:
About the Team

The Activation Squad owns our web app's tactical and strategic tech direction post-signup. It’s a high-impact role with the ability to influence all parts of CookUnity. Our customers use our digital experience weekly to find their favorite meals from our 300+ item menu, and the Engagement Squad is responsible for making that easy and delightful.

The role

As a Senior Full Stack Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in our Activation Squad, directly reporting to the Engineer Manager.

Collaborating closely with a Product Manager and a designer, you'll co-lead the squad to shape the product strategy, define OKRs, and chart the roadmap. Your responsibilities will extend to maintaining regular communication with senior management, providing updates on status, risk assessment, and the broader product strategy.

This position offers an opportunity to drive meaningful impact within our team and organization, contributing your expertise to guide our product's growth and success.

This is our current stack:

Languages: Javascript, Typescript
Frameworks: ReactJS, Redux, Apollo GraphQL, NestJS, NextJS
Infrastructure: AWS, Kubernetes, Terraform, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Snowflake, Redis, DataDog, Segment
Agile Methodology
Service Oriented Architecture

Responsibilities:

  • Owning the design and implementation of platform features within our Javascript stack that engages customers and has a meaningful impact on people’s lives.
  • Iterating on new and existing features to improve user experience and performance.
  • Actively contribute to the adoption of strong software architecture, development of best practices, and new technologies.
  • Improving the maturity of our technical stack with engineering best practices.
  • Being part of the code review process and helping to mentor other engineers.
  • Contribute technically to projects by being a hands-on coder, removing roadblocks, and repairing technical issues.
  • Partner with members of Product, Growth, Marketing, Customer Experience and other teams to continually refine and improve our product in an agile process.
  • Helping to have higher levels of uptime & supporting the on-call rotation that will help the business run 24/7

Minimum Requirements:

  • You have at least +5yrs of experience as a Software Engineer, and you can engage with projects in ReactJS, NodeJS, GraphQL, MySQL, and TypeScript.
  • You have experience designing and building cloud architecture, backends, middle ends, web apps, basically the whole combo!
  • Experience implementing and maintaining unit tests and e2e tests.
  • Strong knowledge of service-oriented architectures.
  • You understand how to interact with and build backend REST APIs.
  • Familiarity with continuous integration.
  • Advanced level of English

Preferred requirements:

  • You're proficient in relational database management.
  • Experience working with Docker/Kubernetes/CI environments.
  • You enjoy working in small teams in a fast-paced startup environment.
  • Previous experience leading or mentoring teams is highly valued.

Benefits

• Get paid in USD, Crypto, Euro, ARS. Whatever your choice! We use Deel to make things easier for you!

•Work remotely: design the life that you want.

•Enjoy 15 days of vacation each year from the start date.

•16 fully paid Argentinean holidays.

•Compassionate Leave: 3-5 days each time the need arises.

•Family leave of 12 weeks for primary caregiver and 6 weeks for secondary caregiver, fully paid.

• Wellness benefit: Gympass subscription, a well-being platform that offers the best coverage of top gyms, studios, and activities for you to choose from.

job.title: SEM Marketing Manager
job.body:
About the Team

Our Performance Marketing team embodies a spirit of innovation and agility, founded on a bedrock of experimentation and data-driven strategies. Our team members are valued for their ability to strike a balance between achieving tangible results and taking daring, high-reward risks.

The role

This role will support new product launches, test new Google products, and bring new concepts to life. You’ll to the Director of Performance Marketing.

You will join a rigorous and experimental team focused on data-driven marketing while taking big bets on exciting opportunities. We are excited by team members who can deliver on both in a fast-paced environment.

You will partner closely with Product, Growth and Design to pressure test and evolve our ads and landing pages over time.

This is a full-time hire.

Responsibilities

  • Build, scale and optimize paid search channels, including Google AdWords, Bing, YouTube, and others.
  • Work cross-functionally to create and manage search campaigns to meet business goals and objectives.
  • Perform keyword research; create, execute, monitor, and optimize campaigns.
  • Provide regular and ad-hoc channel performance reports, including weekly reporting to leadership.
  • Continuously learn and stay on top of trends and best practices. Be proactive in discussing and implementing new strategies and tactics.
  • Advocate for a seamless user experience for customers who are finding us through search.
  • Analyze search performance, and user behaviour, to derive marketing decisions and make recommendations to improve performance.

Minimum Requirements:

  • 4+ years of experience in SEM at an agency or startup.
  • A strong understanding of marketing channels along with their relevant KPIs such as CTR, CVR, CAC, LTV, and retention).
  • Strong experience with SEO research tools and analytics platforms (Google Search Console, SEMRush, Ahrefs and others).
  • Experience in working with Excel and SQL.

Preferred requirements:

  • An analytical and results-oriented mindset person who understands the importance of striking a balance between efficiency and scale.
  • Advanced experience with keyword research and writing compelling, keyword-rich title tags, meta descriptions and other copy within brand guidelines and in collaboration with multiple teams for input on high-visibility pages.
  • Ability to work independently on projects and also collaborate as a strong team member.

Benefits

•Health Insurance coverage

•PTO policy and paid sick days

•401k Plan

• Family leave: 12 weeks for primary caregiver and 4 weeks for secondary caregiver, fully paid

•Compassionate Leave: 3-5 days each time the need arises

•A generous amount of CookUnity credits to enjoy our amazing meals, added to your account, monthly

•?•Wellness perks: access to a nutritional coach and fitness subsidies to build a healthy lifestyle

•?•Personalized Spanish coach

•Awesome opportunity to join a company that is looking to change how we eat and how chefs work!

Compensation

All final pay rates will be determined by candidates experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities of the applicant, internal equity, and alignment with market data.

Pay Range for this position

$90,000—$100,000 USD
